description:
Really great, affordable pupusas! 

The two of us ordered the rice & beans combo #2 with a pork and a chicken pupusa. The rice was a nice level of butteriness, and the beans were savory. The pupusas themselves were cooked well and very substantial. You won't need more than 2 to fill up! 

The only meat pupusa they make without cheese (if you're lactose intolerant) is pork. I got two of these, and they were exceptional as well. 

However, if you've got two people, I would recommend getting three pupusas total or you'll feel uncomfortably full afterwards.
author: Yuchen L.

description:
Now this is the place to get your pupusas here in the city!

Personally, I loooovvveeee the spinach and cheese one! 10/10 recommend! The "mixtas" which come with chicharrón, beans, and cheese were pretty good too.

The salsa is one of my favorite things too! I drown my pupusas in it!

Overall, good food for a good price!
author: Karina R.

description:
I've gone here for several years and I just get their pupusas. They were good, nothing fancy. The place itself is a little dirty but for relatively cheap Salvadoran food I think it's fine. However, the food is now overpriced Salvadoran food and the place is still dirty.

I'm especially disappointed by how they've recently changed the pricing on their pupusas. It's one thing to start at $5 for 1 pupusa that used to be $2.50, but the price doesn't make sense when you get to 3 pupusas ($12 with tax, $4 each) then 4 papusas ($18 with tax, $4.5 each now?). I'll be going to other pupuserias in the Mission (ex El Salvador) that have more reasonable pricing.
author: Polina S.

description: Very cute restaurant in SF. Friends recommended that we go here and so we did. The interior is really welcoming with paintings on the wall and the wooden tables and chairs that they have. Food is good, nothing exceptional for me though. Didn't realize having two pupusas can fill you that much. I did enjoy very much their pickled veggies in that jar that they give you once they serve your food- it's unlimited! The server/cashier was nice too. You get free chips when you check in but I wouldn't recommended the free chips because it's a little bit tasteless. Could have used more salt in it. I'm still giving this place a 5 star for the overall experience :) such a good spot to hang out with friends.
author: Anne V.

description:
Come here drunk. Come here sober. Just come here for their pupusas.

I had the 2 for $7 beef and pork pupusas with their homemade sauce and side of pickled cabbage slaw and I'm telling y'all I wanted more.

Now I can see why people opted for the meal plan which has rice and guacamole and some other sides. Hence the meal part.

But, you can honestly make a meal out of the hot and fresh pupusas themselves.

The meat, both pork and beef, are flavorful and well seasoned, and the staff is friendly.

There was no issue when I bought my Boba Guys drink in and saw the sign saying no outside drinks, they were cool with it, so I tipped them well for not making me throw it away.

I also got a alfajores cookie there which was buttery and great.

A perfect dessert to an equally perfect meal.
author: Jack R.

description:
Is it me or food tastes much better late night. After a wonderful show we saw the painted pupusa sign above the door and this definitely hits the spot. 
This place has been around for a long time instead of the new influx of mission restaurants that cater to people looking for more refined meals and $$$, this place is a good Mission OG.

The pupusas are cheesy with a little meat. The rice is not your typical Spanish rice found in most taquerias and has a nice balanced subtle flavor with enough depth to make me want to eat a whole plate of rice. They use black beans for the refried beans which is delicious. On every table there is a plastic vessel of pickled cabbage with other veggies which is refreshing. The alfajores is just ok and it's messy to eat which they do warn you. There's a guitarist who sings some nights which adds to the authentic feel of this place.

I definitely recommend this place for a late night, affordable eats.
author: Rey L.

description: I have not Pupusas that good in at least ten years.  My food was cooked "con amor".  Those beans and plantains, though simple ingredients, the taste is far from it.  I often say, if you can make staple foods taste euphoric, that is the sign of GREAT cook/chef.
author: Ryan F.

description:
I haven't had such amazing pupusas in a very long time! The place is really cute and quite spacious with a lot of seating. You go up to order and then they bring you your order. The staff is super friendly and nic  and the overall service is really quick. 

My group ordered a total of six pupusas, chips and salsa, and the fried cheese. The chips were fresh and super tasty and crispy while the cheese was amazing! The size was good and it was salty and perfectly fried. As for the highlight of the meal, all of the pupusas were amazing! We got two mixtas which contained cheese, beans, and pork. These were my favorite as the flavor was amazing and the cheese really rounded off the entire puppies. The other top highlights are the chorizo with cheese as well as the mushroom with cheese. I wasn't expecting these to be as good as they actually were. The squash flower and chipotle pupusas were good as well. Overall you can't seem to go wrong with whatever you order - though I'd really recommend the mixta one. I love how the curtido is served in a large bucket so you can really eat your fill.

My group of three es totally stuffed with these pupusas as they were really hefty and jam packed with filling. They excelled our expectations - the filling was incredibly tasty for all of them and the dough was on point!

Overall, I can't wait to come back to this place to fulfill all of my pupusa and fried cheese cravings!!!!
author: Valeria S.

description:
We had the chicken pupusas! If you like cheese, it's for you! For what it is, it's good! If you check into their yelp, you can get free salsa and chips! The pupusas comes with a salsa and slaw. 

Service: Quick service and very friendly!

Location: Its in heart of the Mission. Very easy to locate.  

Check out my photos!
author: Anita T.

description: The best pupusas I ever had were made by my moms friend. Hands down homemade pupusas are the best. I wanted to try this spot for a while because I overlooked that they give curtido in little barrels, so I don't have to call waiters for refills. This got me really excited, but I was disappointed. I ordered 3 pupusas one with queso con loroco with rice dough, cheese with beans with corn dough, and revueltas with corn dough. The rice Pupusa was really hard to chew and it was more dough than cheese/loroco. The other ones were meh to bland. I also had casamiento with fried plantain, sour cream, and fried cheese. It was mediocre the fried plantains were to hard. The curtido was ok and the sauce too. If you want good pupusas go to Balompie #3 on 30th and Mission that's the spot.
author: Engie V.

description: The staff are very friendly and the food is scrumptious. I love the wide open area for sitting and meeting new people.
author: Marquetta S.

description:
So I try to come to this place at least once every month. They have a variety of papusas, but I always get the meat ones. Load those bad boys up with some slaw and salsa that are on every table and you usually only need two for a good meal. Sometimes I'm adventurous and get three. 

This place is also great for late night eats, and usually pretty busy. They serve beer and have a decent amount of seating.  Mariachi bands are also likely to come through. 

I know some people that come here and eat slaw with a side of papusas. Kinda slow waiting for the food. Located very close to BART.
author: Rajeev S.

description: Hands down the best Papusas in the city. Friendly and efficient customer service. Really good fresh juices to pair with the dishes. The slaw is so good you could eat it by itself. If I could eat this every week I would.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Amazzzziinggg pupusas for a great price! $4 for one, or you can get more/a combo to get a good deal. There are a lot of options on the menu that appeal to both veggie lovers and meat eaters! My Spinach papusa filled with oozey cheese. Love when some of the cheese bursts out of the dough and gets really crispy. Top your pupusa with their pickled cabbage and salsa and you got a great bite.

It gets really busy and the pupusas are made to order, so it can take a while for you to get your food. I suggest buying a beer to sip on while you wait!
author: Courtney N.

description:
Had my first pupusas here and I think this was a great place to start. Loved the decor inside. Everything felt super authentic and really did feel like I was in the Mission.

Felt like a microcosm of the city inside. There were all kinds of people uniting over a love of pupusas and I was glad to be a part of it. I ordered the combo plate and had a chicken pupusa and a spinach one. They were very filling and tasty. The salsa and pickled cabbage added a lot of flavors.

Definitely will come back again.
author: Waleed S.

description:
I LOVE PANCHITA'S SO MUCH you won't even understand until you've been there. I ate at Panchita's Pupuseria at Spark Social SF and I was SOLD. I live super far but I came all the way to the Mission to eat here.

I ordered the same thing I got at the other Panchita's - combo #1 with two pork pupusas, which comes with guac, sour cream, plantains, and beans. The plantains are TO DIE for, man. They're sweet but perfectly charred so kinda bitter in the best way. The guac and sour cream are pretty standard, I like to scoop them on top of the pupusas when I eat them. The pupusas OKAY HERE WE GO are AMAZING. There's literally just meat and cheese in there (if you order the pork like I did), but it tastes sooooooo good. I drown the boi in the salsa, and with the guac and sour cream, it's a dream come true. I'm not Salvadoran and didn't grow up eating pupusas so I'm not sure if i'm eating them correctly or not but it's pretty freaking good the way I ate them with everything (don't forget the free veggie things!) 

The restaurant has a ton of seating and is super cute, with pretty murals on the wall. It's also a place you could eat alone (I saw a lot of people doing so) and not feel awkward, so I would definitely come alone if i'm ever in the area. The only thing was that the food isn't that fast (I think I waited 10-15 minutes) so I wouldnt come here if you're in a rush. Since I wasn't in a hurry it was perfectly fine and worth the wait because the pupusas again were just so dang nabbit good. A mariachi band also came in from outside to play while we were eating which was fun to watch. 

I hope they open more locations. I LOVE DIS PLACE
author: Brittany H.

description: My absolute fave is the Loroco papusas. Their prices keep going up each year, but I'm sure the rent does too. You get 1 for 5 2 for 8 and 3 for 12. They have great yuca fries as well. This is my favorite papusa place in SF. It reminds me of when I was in El Salvador trying a papusa for the first times they special slaw they have a red sauce is to die for. Try this place for sure.
author: Julianne O.

description:
Yumyumyumyumyum. 

So, I didn't know about the food score before coming here. All I can say is it was delicious and I definitely didn't get sick, so there's that.

The papusas were SO GOOD. I got the pork one and the mushroom w garlic. Don't forget to add heaping piles of pickled cabbage and salsa to your deliciousness. Wash it all down with a beer for good measure.

The little cookies are really good too. Cute ambiance as well!
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Pupusas were good but the true star of the show was the slaw + hot sauce. 10/10 could eat at least one jar, if not two!

If you like slaw, but are okay with the to-go bags of slaw Panchita's has, get your pupusas to go also. They are the perfect complement to a sunny picnic at Dolores Park. Pork pupusas, neon orange jarritos, and (probably) a windy day - what could be better?
author: Hannah H.

description: I wish I could've given this place 10 stars!!!! This is real home cooked food! My mother is from Guatemala and our dishes are similar! This food is amazing! Very nice staff!! All around it tasted like my moms cooking! I wish I was closer to eat more often!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Thank goodness for this place. I have come after morning yoga and after a very very long night out and either times the quality is just as good. 

I'm not sure where the low health score comes from. Is it the bucket of slaw? I tell myself it's the open buckets of slaw sitting out so I can continue to eat the pupusas here regardless. The spicy Jack links pupusa is divine, as is the basil. (Honestly, all of them are delicious, because you're just adding to cheesy goodness. You can't go wrong!)

You can definitely go right with the combo plates. The beans. Guac. Plantains. Rice. My mouth salivates as I type this review. Just do yourself a favor and get a combo plate.
author: Jenny L.

description: I used to eat this food but I bought pupusas and a fly appears in the food. You must be careful about those horrible mistakes.
author: Iris L.

description: This place is legendary. So good! I would highly recommend these pupusas. They are savoury, crispy, a tad spicy, ugh just the best combinations of flavour. They hand make everything, specifically the curtido (cabbage slaw). Love this place!!! Definitely give it a go, you won't be disappointed. Also, easy on the wallet ;)
author: Bianca E.

description:
Tldr - traditional and Yum factor is very high

Papusas are Papusas, and these Papusas are very bomb.com.

Meat is seasoned well and they are very cheesy. Hot off the grill with a nice chewy bread. Some really good tastes.

Salsa can probably be a bit spicier or less simple - I didn't feel it added super great flavor. The side veg was bomb though. 

One thing - I literally couldn't tell the difference between the chicken and pork. They were both good don't get me wrong but the flavor of the meats didn't stand on their own
author: Samraaj B.

description: Staff not extremely helpful. They kinda stare at you as you look up and down the menu and don't offer help. Ordered an horchata, to my surprise it is NOTHING like Mexican horchata. We didn't end up drinking it. Pupusas were tasty. Wish there was a spicier salsa, and fresh cabbage etc instead of the one that stays on the table for all to use. Over I would eat again.
author: Michelle L.

description: Yummy pupusas!!! You can order as separately or combo! I got the mushroom and garlic and pork - they were both very delicious!! My friend got the zucchini one and that was very good as well! Definitely recommend!!
author: Theresa H.

description:
I thought I had eaten pupusas before eating here, but I think that's like saying I've had ramen when all I've tried is cup o noodles. 

These pupusas are large so you don't need to get more than a couple if you're hungry or three if you're starving. I highly recommend mixing the hot sauce with the pickles which come in a plastic bucket, a sign of authenticity.
author: Kaison T.

description: Amazing!  Their prices do keep going up though. 1 for $5, 2 for $8 and 3 for $11.  It's super casual inside and decorated like you're in a South American hole in the wall.  I loved the pork, but there are so many options and they all come out steaming hot with melty cheese.  There are large jars of vinegar slaw that you put on top of the pupusas - this slaw actually makes the meal.  They take credit cards!
author: Alexandra L.

description: First time having Salvadorian food. The pupusas were very tasty along with the beans and rice. Everyone was very friendly. The food was served fresh and hot. Definitely was a great start to our day. Highly recommend.
author: Alisa R.

description:
Pupusa heaven! 

I had two pupusas and a soda for less than 10 bucks. The pupusas were fresh and hot and the salad and sauce on the table was a great touch.
author: Jessica G.

description:
Can't count how many times I've been to this spot. 

The pupusas here are the best. Try them all, they are all delicious. I like the mushroom & garlic one. I had never tried a mushroom pupusa before this and it did not disappoint.

It smells like heaven when you walk in here. You get a lot of food for not much money & they also sell beer.

The place itself is just a little hole in the wall but if you manage to find it, please do yourself a favor and have some dang pupusas.
author: Sandra N.

description:
Just thinking about this place makes me nauseous. Everything about it is dirty and grimy, and your fellow patrons look drunk, high, and out of it and make the whole place a total mess.

The papusas are pretty bland and you get bored of the flavor after five bites. They're no match when compared to El Salvador, also in the Mission, which is far cleaner and has such fluffy, cheesy, fresh papusas.

Yuck.
author: Bonnie G.

description:
Don't be put off by the low health score rating.
My mouth is watering just writing this review...

I came here almost weekly with my coworker when we worked in the area.
Papusas are definitely one of my favorite foods.
That being said, their papusas are BOMB. It's hard to find good papusas (or any for that matter).
The parking sucks, but if you call ahead, just pop into the alley next door for a few mins to grab your food.
They've never gotten our order wrong.

I usually get 2-3 the chicaron y queso without the beans (too heavy for me) and my coworker would get revuelta.
They don't skimp out on the fillings like many places do so you can get full off just a couple. I like to order extra and eat them for dinner. hehe

They pack everything up very nicely so you can eat at the office (or car, perhaps?) and give you plenty of curtido and salsa, so you don't have to worry about that.
The salsa has a nice spice to it, and the curtido is always fresh and crunchy.

Anytime I'm in the area for lunch, I definitely ask to go to Panchita's 2!

Heard that they are under new management, will have to update review if any changes...
author: Connie T.

description:
Terrible service, the prices dramatically were increased but the lack of service is still terrible.

So many other better popuserias on mission!
author: Rodolfo N.

description: Good food. Good prices. Amazing Pupusas!! Close to 16th BART. I got 5 pupusas to go with a Mexican come for 23 bucks. Will come back for sure. Open late!
author: Andrew A.

description: Got the combo 1 with chicken and beef pupusas. I've never had pupusas before but they were decent, and very cheesy. The wait time was rather long and some of the dishes and glasses were dirty. Overall a decent place if you don't mind waiting.
author: Jason C.

description:
Stumbled upon this place over the weekend, it's a small place that can be easy to miss. 

We tried their platanos, pupusas, tamales, yuca AND their pastelitos. I'm have pretty high standards for my Salvadoran food, but I can happily say everything was delicious! Highly recommend! I will definitely continue coming whenever I'm in the Mission! 

The people were also great, which helps!
author: Johana M.

description:
I find myself here far too often than I really should admit --- Friday nights after a round of debauchery at the local Mission bars.  Go to order for a group of 4: 2 chicken pupusas, 2 pork pupusas, and 2 mushroom & garlic pupusas. It usually soaks up all the alcohol consumed, enough to remember the Uber ride back to the Peninsula.

Also, if you're feeling adventurous, get the rice & beans combo with the pupusas.  Best rice & beans I've ever had in the Mission!
author: Anne D.

description: One of the better, authentic pupusa places in the Bay Area!! I came here with 8 others and squeezed onto their middle table but we all fit and had a great time eating together. I loved their Guanabana (soursop) drink. We all got different pupusas and specials but everyone enjoyed what they got! Make sure to come hungry!!
author: Mora O.

description: Was craving pupusas and came across this place on Yelp. Food definitely great, it's a nice place with space to sit and enjoy lunch. The rice and beans are also delicious. I got full as portions are large. Price is affordable, I'll be bringing my friends next time I'm in area.
author: Lance R.

description: I go here once a week and it's always the greatest. I always get the bean and cheese pupusas. If I'm really hungry I'll get a combo but if not I'll just do two pupusas. You have to eat it with the cabbage and tons of red sauce on top for the flavors. The water looks a little sketch so I'd probably bring my own bottle. But other than that, it's definitely a must grab in the mission. They have a food truck outside that serves at the same time as the restaurant as well as a truck out at SPARK social if you can't make it to the restaurant.
author: Kalani R.

description: First tried panchitas after a night out in the mission because they're open late. We tried a few different pupusas and they were all amazing! Although I think my favorite is the spinach and cheese! The pickled cabbage and the salsa they provide gives the pupusas and extra kick of flavor. After the first visit, I started going back there pretty much every time my fiancé and I go to see improv shows around the corner at stage Werx. The only downside is they are understaffed right now and the orders take a while to come out but it's worth the wait and the lady running the cashier and waiting tables all by herself is super sweet!
author: Annie L.

description: Wonderful service and great location in the Mission! They can do large orders and great for take-out or dining in the restaurant. So many different pupusas! And they are DELICIOUS!
author: Sarah N.

description: Panchita's is good when you're coming back from bar-hopping in the mission, but otherwise, I wouldn't go there. I've had other pupusas in the city that taste 100x better, and have a smaller price tag ($2.75). I always get the queso con lorrocco pupusa and probably give this a 2/5. The cheese isn't as flavorful and the flour to stuffing ratio isn't that great. Perhaps I have high standards as I come from a Salvi family (and I've gone multiple times), but these are OK.
author: Irene G.

description: I've been coming here for years. While they have a reasonably extensive menu. I've never gotten anything other than pupusas. They are so good, and you can smother as much hot sauce or pickled coleslaw on it as you want. Still one of my favorite places to visit as frequently as I can get there.
author: Dave K.

description:
This is the spot to hit for pupusas. A pupusa is like a flat and pancake-shaped tamale. It's bomb. Get the combo with rice and beans and two tamales of your choice. I like the chicken and jalapeños. Definitely use the cabbage salad on top and splash the hot sauce on top. Careful because the hot sauce is actually hot and not just for color or show. 

Haven't been to this spot in a while but it used to be a favorite after clubbing. They're open til 2:30AM on Fridays and Saturdays so it's always a good hit for a late night snack. Beats a dirty dog any night, but just like a Jack in the Box drive thru at 1 AM, many people will likely think it's a great idea as well so brace yourself for a line. 

Don't forget to tip the musicians that roll thru!
author: Jerry Y.

description: 5/5 for late night pupusas. Cheap, and perfect carb/fat ratio for a late night food. The line gets long, but it is so worth it. Make sure to take advantage of the sauce and veg on the table!
author: Tasha H.

description: Absolutely unreal food. A bit on the pricey side but worth it. You should get combo one. Great horchata
author: Jake B.

description:
Pupusas. Once a month, before my book club, I stop by and pick up two. The flavors are fantastic, and the only problem is I don't know what to do with the giant bag of hot sauce. This is me, the hot sauce fanatic. I would drink it if I was allowed to. However, I hear this is frowned upon in common society, and sadly, I am eating this in a bar down the street while talking to a room full of people about their favorite science fiction and fantasy books. Drinking hot sauce might be looked at as odd, especially from a bag. Ok, so I did it once and it got all over my shirt, do not recommend doing it again. 
HOWEVER, my favorite part is the cheese that gets out of the dough and gets fried by itself and is black and crisp and oh so amazing. Yeh, that's the best...well, that and the price. $7 for two. Yeeees. Extra jalapenos please.
author: Danielle L.

description:
Simple and so delightful when grabbing either a meal, savory bite or a late night munchie on a pupusa!

The texture is like a grilled dough and soft on the inside with filled goodness of whatever choice on the menu, such as pork, cheese or carne asada!

It's like the street food and side shop to go into and be on the down low!  We got to bring our own drinks in - a champagne bottle from a corner liquor shop!  It was great fun to be able to just chill like it's nobody's business and byob! 

Their fried plaintains is quite unique and not often do I get that.  Sweet and crisp! 

I like the options of salsa provided on the side tables and pickled cabbage!  Yum!

Pupusa all star and for the chill vibes win here!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Really affordable and a short walk to other places if you're using public transport! I got there around lunch time on a Saturday and it wasn't too full. I ordered a pork and mushroom&garlic pupusa and the latter was SO GOOD, especially for the price! I'm definitely coming back when I have guests to show around!
author: Rylie B.

description: I live in Colorado, and the moment I land at SFO, I make my way immediately to Panchita's #2. Every time. The chipotle pupusas are DIVINE. I had a long layover at SFO last weekend and it killed me to think of being so close without getting food there that I decided to go to forgo my flight to SMF, go to Panchita's and then just pay to take the the train to Sacramento, rather than flying. I had chipotle pupusas, salsa, extra curtido, and plantains on Ocean Beach and nearly died of pleasure. And yes, it's a great place to eat sola. I love journaling in one of the window seats. Thanks, Panchita's, I'm just another gringa from another state, but, dang, I love you!
author: Emma R.

description:
Specialty - Pupusa (cheese or anything filled tortillas) kind of like a quesadilla. Those who are lactose intolerant, stay away, they're very generous with their cheese.

Parking:
It's SF, uber, but they do have street parking.

Food:
Options with salsa and hot sauce and a cabbage slaw, I wish it was pickled a little more to contrast the pupusa, but this place is packed for drunchies. It does the trick, I think it was $3 for 1 and then $5 for two or something around that range.
author: Jenny Q.

description: My go to place for pupusas. The location is a little sketch (it is the mission district after all) so be careful. It is reasonably priced for high quality food. I make it my mission to always have the jack link pupusas and the spinach one. Totally amazing. Also, make sure you get a side of rice and plantains. Everything is superb there and it is made fast. Just again, be careful.
author: Saeed R.

description:
Lots of cheese.

I ordered the pork and the chicken... It was 75% cheese and 25% meat.  I'm not sure what the correct ratio should be but I love dairy and can't really eat it so this was disappointing.  

Definitely more of a hole in the wall spot, the large buckets of cabbage sitting around each table and giant hot sauces were kind of grimey. 

Good eats after daydrinking though?!  I guess it would be if you were super drunk.
author: Kimberly L.

description: If I can give no stars, I would. We waited over an hour for our food because their staff is completely incompetent as she forgot to put our order in. Hire better people!
author: Celica E.

description: I got a combo 2, two pupusas and rice and beans. Something was off on the chicken one I kept getting a bad after taste. The chicken was really shredded and I enjoyed that asides the taste. The bean and cheese one was bland. The rice and beans were ok. The salsa that you put on top had chipotle and that threw me off.
author: Yvonne B.

description:
# of times said "pupusas" on this review: 7.. lol 

This place definitely has the best pupusas that I've had! $4 for 1, $7 for 2, and 3 for $10

I first time I came, I remember really enjoying the pupusas though I can't exactly remember what I got.. this time I came, I got the jalapeño pupusa (trust me, one isn't enough, but I was already quite full) and it was as delicious as I remembered it to be! The outer part is wonderfully soft and moist, not too thick either since they put a substantially good amount of cheese and jalapeños. You can tell when you see pan fried oozed cheese on the side of your pupusa, and when you bite in, the strings of cheese that come between your mouth and the pupusa. 

I love that they have the pickled vegetables and spicy sauce on the table for you to just stack onto your pupusas. I would HIGHLY recommend that you just stack on these toppings, as it adds a wonderful freshness and crispness to an otherwise slightly heavier dish.
author: Jacqueline T.

description: Great food lots of choices of pupusas. Only issue is curtido is not to fresh sits out on tables for who know how long and everyone uses. Alfajors kinda high for small cookie not much filling. But pupusas were yummy.
author: T G.

description:
The restaurant looked pretty cozy, and had free seats on a Saturday afternoon, so we decided to try it out.

Their only dish is Pupusas -- filled tortillas with cheese and a variety of other ingredients.

I never had them before, so I didn't quite know what to expect. What I got, however, left me very disappointed: Half of the filling escaped during cooking and was subsequently burnt, turning it into a messy mix of black cheese and mushrooms.

Since my friends' dishes looked fine, I thought that was just a mistake by the cook, and they would make me a new one.

When I asked the cashier, though, he just told me that this was normal, and that they're supposed to be made like that.

So unless you're into eating burnt food, I'd strongly advise you to stay away.
author: Mark J.

description: Girllllll, you know what's better than Panchita's after a night out? It's probably my 2nd choice, right after El Farolito, but before McDonald's nuggets. The papusas are great! I love the garlic and mushroom and the beef one! I always get 2 and pile on the all you can eat pickled cabbage and salsa. They're also pretty cheap, not as cheap as the McPick 2 for $5, but for handmade cheese pockets, it's worth! I always end up here whenever I'm around 16th and Valencia for a night out. The line can get pretty long, but they got their business down because it doesn't take long to get your order or food. If you've never had a pupusa from Panchita's before, sister, you ain't living!
author: Eva C.

description:
I've never really understood the hype on pupusas until recently. Since then, I've had it about 5 times and I must say they are indeed pretty tasty, especially after a night of drunken shenanigans :) 

So I've tried both chicken and pork but I can never really tell which is which unless I only order either chicken or pork. I think I like the chicken more. Anyway eat it with the sauce and the coleslaw for maximum tastiness!

I've only had pupusas here so I can't comment on any other food that they serve...
author: Alice L.

description: Came here on a Sunday night for a to-go order. Was craving empanadas but couldn't find a place with it, so I decided to try their pupusas. They have cole slaw sitting in a container at every table. It took 30 minutes for the order to be ready. It would've been more worthwhile if the pupusas actually tasted good. The batter was too floury, it tasted like a pancake filled with canned meat. I'm a huge cole slaw fan and couldn't have more than one bite of the packed cole slaw. I definitely would not return.
author: Katie V.

description: This eatery earned its 5 stars!! 3 hearty pupusas for 11 dollars. Throw the pickled cabbage on there and drench it with the sauce and you're good to go.. look forward to returning.
author: Kensho K.

description: This unassuming spot is hot! Serving a variety of pupusas including the most amazing vegetarian styles. My personal highlight: the fried plantains.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
My roommate and I were craving pupusas, and we got a chance to come here when were at a charity event nearby.

The place is small, and most of the seating is shared.  But you get the food quickly so turnaround is fast.

I got a spinach pupusa, and fried plantains with beans and cream.  I love fried plantains, and these ones were pretty good.  They weren't too sweet, and had a nice texture from the caramel.  The pupusa was delicious, and I loved the spiciness of the salsa available at each table.

Now that I know they take credit cards, I might come here more often!
author: Vira P.

description:
Came here after a day at Dolores. 

Our group of 15 bombarded the place all at once, but I was impressed with how they handled the crowd and how they managed to still crank out the pupusas at a reasonable rate. I've been to pupuserias that have quoted me a 20 minute waiting til upon ordering, despite there being pretty much no one in the restaurant.

I only ordered one revuelta pupusa, and I also got to try part of a spinach one. The revuelta was good and not too heavy, and along with many handfuls of chips and salsa, I was decently full. I had initially made fun of my friend for ordering a spinach pupusa - because who orders spinach at a place like this - but it was actually not bad. It wasn't as good as my revuelta, obviously.
author: Jacqueline V.

description: The people that work here are very nice and the food is pretty tasty. They need to improve on their cleanliness. The entire place could really use a good steam cleaning. It would also be helpful to come up with a better way to serve the fermented cabbage. My son loves this place though we've heard from our Lyft drivers that there's another place that serves better. If you don't care about cleanliness, then you'll probably love this place as much as my son.
author: E T.

description:
As you can tell I don't write very many reviews, but Panchita's had me dust off the old keyboard and document the unfortunate experience. 

Yes: I am the odd one out, at an average of 4 stars you would think this place is good but I will whole heartily disagree. As someone who grew up eating these greasy, delicious bundles of heart disease this has been the worst Pupusa I have ever had... that's including my ill fated attempt of making a healthy version at home. The place is busy, which... good for them. I like to see my Paisonos do well but please oh please serve good food. 

Example: Anyone whose been around enough pupusas will tell you the Curtido is paramount in bringing the flavours (yes, with a 'U') to a wonderful crescendo blending the fat, meat, cheese and bite from the pickled fermented yumminess (also the only healthy part of the meal) into pure heart stopping heaven... What they served was some form of dry cabbage lacking any type of flavor. When I asked if they had more curtido in the back that was a little more "Borracho" (Drunk) the kid serving me had no idea what I was talking about. I clarified that the Curtido was a little dry, he offered to pour more water into the tub....

WATER: Now, if you haven't gotten it by now I really like pupusa's and I don't yelp unless something is phenomenally good or bad... The fact that our server referred to the wonderful vinegar brine used to pickle and ferment curtido as water... well.. mind you I knew what to expect before I even had my first bite of PUPUSAS... 

To those of you who have given this family owned business that has been around since before I was born 4 stars or above.. even 3 stars... I am glad you like it. I am happy that you supporting a local business but you have to try other places. Hop on the 14 and head west, unfortunately my favorite pupuseria is now a spaghetti shack otherwise I would make that recommendation. I can only believe this place is doing well because it is centrally located, I have had it twice now thinking it just might be one bad experience....  It only confirmed that they use thicker drier masa than they should. My friend gave me the recommendation to eat here but I don't think she has been in over 10 years so maybe that is when they were good. Remember, these things are sooo unhealthy for you - every bite should be worth it.
author: David H.

description: I had like zero monies and really wanted something warm and cooked for me. So I went to Panchita's with low expectations that I'd pay $3 and get some low quality warm food and go back to work. I was wrong. I got a huge basket of chips and salsa for $1.50 to eat while i waited for my food and a couple minutes latet got this fresh delicious chickeny cheesey pupusa that was absolutely delicious. If youre on a budget and want some really high quality food, definitely come here.
author: Lauren G.

description:
Very casual pupusería that delivers on cheesy deliciousness and vegetarian options! 

FOOD: All pupusas (vegetarian) we had were scrumptious and expectedly filling. The curtido (cabbage salad) is self serve at the table, luckily, as it is a tangy, light, and crunchy counterbalance to the pupusas. Of the chipotle, mushroom, bean, and spinach pupusas, the bean was the dark horse! Packed with flavor and perfect texture with the cheese. Chipotle had a definite kick (refill your water glass here), and the other two were fine but not the favorites. 

SERVICE: pay at the counter (card OK) and sit with a number. Food comes quickly, tables are cleared promptly, and all the register people were friendly and fun. 

AMBIANCE: laid back and nearly across the divey line. Though it may not be spotless, considering there's so many (happy) people in and out, I consider it an achievement that the tables are cleared and wiped down before you sit. Everyone from solo pupusa lovers to large groups post bar crawl were here. There are tables to seat up to six comfortably.
author: Helen W.

description: Good authentic flavor. Service is great and the environment makes you feel part of the El Salvador since most of its customers are Latinos.
author: David L.

description: The pupusa was alright. It was bit too doughy for me. Ordering was pretty confusing and the seating and table are not that clean. Good if you want a fast cheap and filling meal.
author: Diane Z.

description: I love pupusas so was glad to find this place.  It's only a block away from the 16th St. Bart station.  Inside there is a cozy homey vibe and every table has a big jug of Curtido (Salvadoran coleslaw) on it which is a big plus. Pupusas are rather cheap and very filling.  I usually get 2 but one can fill me up easily especially if I put a lot of curtido on it.  They have a good selection of vegetable pupusas to choose from.  My favorites are Jalapeno and Basil.
author: Joan W.

description: I have been waiting for my food for about 25 minutes  thelady brought out all the orders onto the counter, he proceeded to help out customers at a table, then he went on to put a heater for another customer and 3 customers showed up to order he went on to take their order after he took their order he decided to just play with the food I'm thinking he was trying to maybe see what order was which he then kept staring I stared at him back like hellooooo I been here for a while now.. mind you he was flirting with a customer right before me, he gave her a free modelo because I understand Spanish so I understood what they were saying. Anyways that's not my business but ummmmm I'm just rating based on customer service I had to write it before I start eating my food.. catch me here again I food is horrible but I hope not!!
author: Griselda R.

description:
$3 savory pupusa bombs? That hits all the marks

The place itself can look a little run down but if you go during the day, it tends to be pretty quiet and the food more than makes up for that. Grabbed a pork and beef pupusa as a quick snack before starting my full day of food touring. The pork was super tender, juicy and flavorful. The beef on the other hand, was a bit lacking both in quantity and flavor. The pupusas come out nice and hot and have the perfect crunch on the outside with each bite. I'd definitely recommend having it with the salsa.
author: Jason W.

description: Only reason I'm giving this four stars is because it was my first papusa. So good though. Relied on the recommendation of the guy behind the counter and got one pork and one mushroom & garlic. Did not disappoint and will absolutely be back next time I'm in SF.
author: Joe A.

description:
Visiting from the east coast and I have to say this place is WAY better than anything I've had back home. As an El Salvadorean I think this place is by far the closest to what real El Salvadorean food is. 

Amazing food....#PupusasForDays
author: Alexander R.

description: I wanted to try some authentic Salvadoran food and I was impressed. The pupusas are absolutely delicious on their own (I had the spinach and my friend had the chicken). When put together on a combo plate with beans, it is quite the gustatory experience. The plantains tasted fresh and light, and complemented the savory pupusas with their sweetness.
author: Veronica L.

description: Always try to catch this when I'm in the neighborhood. Papusas are just yum. Try the spicy sausage.
author: Ben L.

description:
To put simply:

Food: 5 stars, great for the price, fresh and hot, extremely tasty.

Service: 1 star, waited 30 minutes for a to-go order while I watched others who ordered after me receive their orders before me. I decided to confront the cashier who handled the situation very poorly. Yes, he apologized, but laughing it off does not show me that he was serious about anything that happened. 

Overall: 2 stars, I would go here again if I was guaranteed a papusa before the people I ordered. The food is great, but their priorities may not be straight.
author: Jasmine T.

description:
No kidding, but sometimes I think about these pupusas. The food is fresh, fast, and the waiter is quite friendly (although to be honest, service isn't something that I'm too concerned with if the food is good).

I strongly recommend getting the combo where you can choose any 2 pupusas and it comes with extra rice and bean mash on the side. I chose the mix" (pork, cheese, beans) and the mushroom pupusas and I think that's the winning package because you get to try one of everything in terms of fiber, protein, and dairy. The extra rice and bean mash really sealed the deal. 100% would come again!

Only downside that's docking a star off this review is the food was as hot as I'd have liked. But flavors were still there when the food was served warm.
author: Sammy T.

description: I love this place went here for pride and we are going back today!!!! Can't wait this place is sooo good!
author: Ashlee P.

description:
I used to love this place. Their prawn cocktail was awesome.  So was their beef soup.  Well no more as their reduced menu only has pupusas and a few meat and seafood dishes.   None of my favorites.  I get why they did it but still disappointed. 

Pupusas are still good but both the grilled prawn and fried fish dishes we ordered this time were overcooked and a bit bland.   Maybe it's an off day for me as hubby loved it still but I am no longer a fan of this place. 

It has now dropped from my list of go to dive restaurants.  :-(. Bummer.
author: Lei H.

description:
Can't believe I haven't been here sooner.  This is a cute hole in the wall pupuseria. Their specialty is pupusas obvi.  They've got a few other plates like rice and beans with plantains and crema.  But their pupusas are the ones! 

They've got various types: chipotle, jalapeño, pork, chicken, beef, spinach, garlic and mushroom, loroco, and that's what I can remember.  I went on a Thursday night around 9pm and it took about 25 minutes for my food to be ready.  

Overall, a great spot to go to.  I loved the ambiance.  Felt like I walked into a hole in the wall somewhere in El Salvador!
author: Jill P.

description:
I've honestly never been so disappointed by a restaurant.  It's one thing if the food is less than what we expected or if there was an extra ingredient that we didn't order.  THIS PLACE, straight up left me 45 minutes wondering if my food was ever going to come.  

Once the food runner, who was at least courteous, asked me why I haven't gotten my food I knew this place was a dump.  THEY STRAIGHT UP FORGOT MY ORDER.  No apologies, no sympathy, and they didn't even have my name right.  This place is a joke and if you're hoping to get some junk pupusas, you better pray they don't leave you hanging for 45 minutes just to NEVER PLACE YOUR ORDER.  

I mean hell, even some microwaved soup would've at least put our more than this dump in the wall can. 
I wish there was such a thing as "negative stars" on yelp.  Horrible.
author: Dakota S.

description:
Too many nights out ended here. Amazing pupusas. I love that it's walking distance from 16th street bart. I like to grab a quick snack before yoga and the service here is very quick - less than 10 minutes. 

There is unlimited pickled cabbage and salsa. I like the chicken, beef, mushroom pupusas the best. I still have yet to try the zuchinni one. 

Sometimes there's live music which makes it fun!
author: Yvonne L.

description:
$3/pupusa. We ordered 5 (mushroom, squash blossom, beef, chicken, pork) and had a taste of each one. They were all delicious, though I think I'd skip the beef since it had a strange aftertaste that I couldn't place. The squash blossom was unique and interesting. 

There was only one person working the till and serving the dishes on a Wednesday at lunchtime.

Unfortunately, I did not get the cleanest vibe from the place. The uncovered pickled vegetables were not comforting. I also just got a popup from yelp alerting me about the health rating for this restaurant when I arrived on this page to write the review.
author: Annie C.

description:
It's been a while since I've had pupusas. I used to love eating these as a kid...we used to go to El Zocalo near SSF. This place has a wide arrange of pupusas. Not the most traditional pupusas (no chicharron y frijoles? ...say whatttt?), so I was a little apprehensive about these after seeing that they offered zucchini and basil pupusas. Aside from that, I decided to try their pork and their zucchini flower one. Both pupusas were delicious!

I'm knocking off a star because I could not tell which was which! When having pupusas, I like to be able to taste the difference between the two. They both tasted pretty similar even though one was a vegetarian option and the other wasn't. No lie, the pupusas were so good with the sauce and the cabbage salad (which could be a little spicier!). The combination was amazing and I thoroughly enjoyed the amount of cheese that each pupusa had. They have some random folks playing guitar every once in a while. 

These were definitely pretty good and for $3 a piece, you can't beat that.
author: Natalie M.

description: My boyfriend and I were on a way to lunch on Valencia Street, when we noticed that the Panchita's Restaurant from around the corner had relocated.  We love pupusas, so we ended up coming back and ordering some to-go for dinner later in the day.  My mom makes them, as my family's originally from El Salvador, and so I've had homemade as well as pupusas from different restaurants.  Although my boyfriend was concerned about the authenticity in terms of their cooking approach, by machinery rather than by hand, I thought the taste was quite good and the "cortido" better than any I've tasted before.  The prices here are a bit higher than other places; however, we're planning on coming back, and looking forward to trying the plantains.
author: Sonya G.

description:
We came for a bite around 10pm. On a lively stretch of 16th Street, this place has always been half-empty and seemed a little sad, but we thought it would be a quick stop.

While there was no line to order, the food seemed to take a long time. Like 10-15 minutes, which feels like forever in a spot like this, especially when not many others seemed to be ordering!

The pupusas were lightly crisped on the outside, very very gooey on the inside, but were very oily! Quite heavy for late night food. You won't feel great afterwards. We got cheese and meat fillings, nothing stood out too much to me.
author: Ziyan C.

description: Well worth the wait Pupusas were on hit and not greasy at all!! The Platanos were delish!
author: Iris G.

description: Super delicious pupusas. This cute little place is absolutely delicious. Honestly some of the best food I've ever had
author: Tyler C.

description: Service is horrible here. Made me wait 15-20mins because he was busy, when I was the only one in line and there was hardly any people at the restaurant. Food is good but shitty service.
author: Liz M.

description:
While the steadily declining health score is worrisome and not the best sign, I have to say that my experience was not uncomfortable and my party were all impressed by the relatively good cleanliness, service, and quality of food.

The pupusas were amazing-- for 3 out of 4 of us, it was our first time having any, and we are all big fans now! We tried the chicken, spinach, and just cheese, and they were delicious. At each table there is a coleslaw-like mix (with no lid-- would not be surprised if it were part of the health violation) and hot sauce, which both pair well with the pupusas.

Can't comment on parking, but it's a close walk from the BART station on 16th.
author: Aidan S.

description: Never ever coming here again.  $5.00 for a pupusa.  There's more money 's worth stuffed in a taco than the over priced cheese stuffed corn dough disk.  Don't get me wrong, I love pupusas but Panchitas has poor quality to begin with in comparison to other Pupuserias in the San Francisco and to charge that much is outrageous.  They seem to be doing very well with the tipsy crowd strolling by after the clubs on the weekends, but for the sober lunch crowd, this is not ure place.
author: Eduardo M.

description: I love pupusas! I made the trip up to SF just to have some freshly made pupusas for my birthday. During the day this place isn't that busy but in the evening and night the place gets pretty crowded. It's a small restaurant with communal tables. They serve bottled beer.
author: Aya D.

description: These papusas are incredible. Hot, crispy, cheesy and generally perfectly made, even when it's 2 am with a line out the door. Try the chipotle one for a spicy cheesy filling!
author: Laura F.

description: I can only review on the drunk late night drunchies and YAS! It's so amazing this place is open late and on 16th and Mission! Your drunken nights are over burning yourself trying to make instant ramen, getting food poisoning from dirty dogs, and eating cold pizza. Stumble on over to this place for some yummy pupusas! They have tons of different options and sugar cookies for dessert! Your drunk butt will not be sorry you visited this place! Don't go home because you're drunk, come eat pupusas first.
author: Marcie A.

description: The pupusas here are delicious! Fat plump cheesy pupusas! What has changed is immediately getting the chips and salsa... you now have to ask and pay for them which for me is disappointing cause it's just custom to receive that when eating at a sit down. Casual in/out eatery.
author: Dee G.

description: Pretty basic Salvadoran food. I gave it to some of my Salvadoran friends who met me at Dolo and they weren't really fans of it either. I did like the pricing as well as the rice and beans which were amazing. Everything was made to order so it might take some time for you to get your food but that wasn't really an issue because everything came out hot. I got the mushroom and garlic pupusa as well as the chicken. The chicken was most definitely moist and flavorful while the garlic and mushroom was way too salty.
author: Navdeep D.

description: We waited a while for our food but it was so worth it. Super delicious for both meat and veggie dishes.
author: Lynn M.

description: Good food and good place for a quick dinner. Lots of seating and cheap prices. Get the combo!
author: Myleen R.

description: You walk in and you're in El Salvador! I get a few bean and cheese pupusas with chips and salsa. Sometimes, there is a long wait, but it's worth it!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
These papusas gave me life! Okay, not really, they probably do nothing for my diet, but they were delicious to say the least. Let's just say that I purchased one, scarfed it down, and immediately went back to purchase two more (what can I say, my inner day girl was screaming for more of that papusa goodness). Here's the lowdown:

Likes:
-CHEAP!! Only $3/papusa (and who doesn't love a deal)
-pretty fast turnaround service
-attentive staff
-did I mention the papusas are delicious?!?
-located near BART (for all you Eco-conscious/carless folks)

Dislikes
-not really any dislikes except for the possible health code violation/food borne illness that could potentially result from eating the slaw(not sure how often its refreshed, who's digging in it to eat with clean/dirty paws, etc). But hey, that's a small price to pay for some yummy goodness. 


Definitely a must for anyone visiting the Mission and/or has never had a papusa. Can't wait to check this place out again!
author: Tracy T.

description: This place is a must-visit every time I'm in town. Pupusas are worth the wait! Theirs are a little richer, creamier inside with a softer crust than pupusas I get in NYC. Delicious sauce and slaw too.
author: Madame W.

description:
My first pupusas, too.  They were darn good.  I ordered three (spinach, chicken, and beef) for $10.  Two (for $7) would have been enough.  They're pretty filling.  (Kaison T. was right).

The place is homey and friendly, the food is good, and inexpensive.  I will definitely be back.
author: Steve C.

description:
After a night out, seeing a place like this open next door is a sight for sore eyes. From what I can remember, the pupusa was delicious. At $3 a piece, it can't be beat. The cole slaw and the salsa in pourable containers on our table made it that much better, too. It only took me one pupusa to be stuffed and to bring me back to life from the night's shenanigans. Not bad for a late night snack.

The only downside was that it was hard to distinguish which pupusa was which when they gave us our food. Even after taking a bite, we still couldn't tell which one had meat and which didn't. It would be nice if they could specify which was which  when they give it to us or at least separate them accordingly so we don't have to play the guessing game. Also, Yelp is currently showing they have a low food safety score which is a bit concerning.
author: Gabrielle S.

description: This is a cute place with adorable staff and a good place to go to for a quick bite. Food might take some time to make depending on order.
author: Ranjani S.

description:
Best pupusas I've ever had. 
The lines can get long so make sure to go Before 10pm... That's when the drunk Mission crowd takes over. Also make sure to get the mushroom and garlic. I had 5 in a 3-day span. Don't judge me. 
Service is always good here too. The staff is top notch, personable and very friendly.
author: Jay O.

description: I love this spot. I had a combo #1 garlic+mushroom pupusa and jackilinks pupusa. They're rice is bomb af! Good portion and muy delicioso :) I was full and happyyyy!
author: Lovelee C.

description: I've been here too many times to count! Pupusas are delicious and filling, and only cost $3 a pop! There's a great selection of both carnivorous and vegetarian fillings, so you can get something different each time. The homemade tortilla chips are warm and crispy, and the salsa is just spicy enough to fill my capsaicin cravings without making me sweat pitchers of water. It's only a minute walk from the 16th Street Mission station, so it's easy to get to from just about anywhere in downtown. Definitely worth a stop!
author: Shawn W.

description:
Delicious pupusas ($3)!!!
Not too greasy.
Perfectly paired with the pickled cabbages (despite the slightly unsanitary set up of the pickle tub..) I liked the unpretentious setting, delicious food, and live music that comes around.

I also got the beef stew with lots of veggies ($7), which was hearty but light, great for a rainy day or pick up to go home.

Omg.. the fried plantains (~$5).. unexpectedly delicious. You have to try it at least once.

Definitely coming back again.
author: Maggie G.

description: The repollo is not same anymore. I used to go specifically for it. The pupusas are still good but the to go option of placing them in individually wrapped aluminum foil, makes them stuck to the foil, losing a lot of the actually pupusa. Will probably continue to visit but will explore other options as well.
author: Cristina P.

description: My first time having Pupusas and wow they were so good. The rice and beans i got was also good. I already have plans to go back at the end of the week!
author: Nate P.

description:
13/10 will be back next time I'm in SF. The pupusas are AMAZING! The mushroom & garlic pupusa has a very pleasant flavor. You can't go wrong with that one. If you like spice, I highly recommend the chipotle pupusa. It's not super spicy, but the smoky flavor of the chipotles is excellent. There's a little kick and a lot of chipotle flavor. A+ pupusa.

The plantains are great, too.
author: Mindy P.

description: Awesome spot. The chipotle and jalapeño were killer. Get the plate because the beans are great too!
author: Jane V.

description:
I have been eating papusas since I was 15 and I used to love going to El Zocalo and other places in the Mission that have since closed :-(  I was in the Mission and got a craving for a papusa and decided to give this place a try since it is on my way to bart.  
I walk in and notice all the people which is a good sign, but everyone has numbers on their table so they are waiting for their food.  I think, well two papusas shouldn't take that long, wrong.  I waited 25 minutes, yikes. 
The service wasn't great, the guy at the counter barely acknowledged me, I think he was stressed since I am guessing there was a large lunch order and the kitchen was behind.
All in all the place didn't feel that clean to me and the bathrooms were gross.  I also don't like how they have a plastic container on the table which has the cortido.
I got the loroco and cheese, which were both pretty decent, I would probably eat them again.
Yes, it was good, not my favorite but satisfied my craving.
author: Molly M.

description:
Some of the best pupusas I've ever had.  Was close by after the Amory Tour and my friend said we had to go here so we did.

Delicious fillings and the sauce perfect.  Has a fantastic mild kick.

I'm hungry reviewing this place and thinking about it again.
author: Phillip N.

description:
So first, you should probably know I have been coming to this place for about 10 years now. The Mission has definitely changed in that time, but the quality of the food here hasn't - still one of my favorites.

There are a few different kinds of pupusas to try, including lots of veggie options. They all come with cheese. Some of my favorites if you are just trying them are:
- Chicken
- Loroco (Salvadorean flower, acquired taste for some folks)
- Spinach
- Zucchini 
- Mushrooms and Garlic (I just tried this one and it was hella good!)

Pro tip: add cabbage and the salsa roja on top. Dee-lish! Also, they are open late night. I can't tell you how many times in the past I've come out of Skylark/somewhere close by and my first thought was coming here.

Service is great, food is usually out in about 10-15 minutes, which is typical when ordered pupusas (they gotta cook 'em!)
author: Neda S.

description:
We wanted a pre-dinner snack while hanging around the mission, so we strolled into Panchita's.  

PUPUSAS
Cheese
Jalapeno- fav
Pork
 
Pupusas were great. Cabbage was even better.   

I don't know about this low food safety inspection score, but as the queen of food poisoning...I had no issues.  Phew!
author: Lyn C.

description:
Panchita's Pupusaria is my go-to post drinking spot. Hot cheesy pupusas with unlimited slaw and hot sauce is exactly what I need after an evening of drinking. 

I'd say 1 pupusa is satisfying, but I don't live in the mission, so If I get the chance to come out here I spring for that second one. 2 pupusas will leave you really full and they're only a few bucks each. 

I have tried mushroom & garlic, pork, and beans & cheese in the past. I didn't find the mushroom to be especially memorable, but I was pleasantly surprised by the beans and cheese pupusa (Classic). 

If you come here really late it tends to get more crowded and it slows down service (which is expected since sometimes its one person in the back slinging hot pupusas around. No one is perfect.) 

I like the laid back atmosphere with the picnic style benches and chairs. I find it amusing that the decor is made to look like an outdoor tin roof seating area. 

Come here to laugh it up with your friends and joke around with the staff. In the process you can attempt to soak up that $15 cocktail thats trying to give you a mad hang over. 

tip: The Alojar shortbread cookies are just OK. Not really worth $1.50 each.
author: Candice C.

description: Best pupusas ever! And the curtido is to die for. I'm from DC and these pupusas beat anything I've had  back home.
author: Lillian T.

description: Loved the complimentary pickled cabbage on the table.  Pupusas are soft and gooey with cheese.  So many choices.  Soups are good with bones. You order at the counter, pay, sit, snd wait for your food be called.
author: Helen L.

description:
You guys ruined my day. I waited over 40 minutes for the simplest, smallest order. 2 of the plantain empanadas. I saw other larger orders come and go while I waited, sweaty and starving. I know pupusas are not fast food, but I didn't even order pupusas.
The same thing happened to me last week, with the same order and I thought it was a one off bad day. Unfortunately, I will probably never return here.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Rice and beans need more flavor. Pupusas are really good though, they're soft and delicious!!! The staff needs to smile and not have a stank face.
author: Stephanie A.

description: Best pupusa's ever! I eat here once a month religiously and have never been disappointed. The longer you wait the better (more crispy) they get! Support local business in the Mission!
author: Jenn S.

description:
So yummy! Every time I'm in the Mission, I visit this place. I got the beef and the chipotle pupusas. Both were very well cooked, stuffed with wonderful, delicious fillings, and quite filling. They are reasonably priced too! The service was a little slow, but I think it was because there was only one poor soul cooking that day. 

Pupusas are naturally gluten free, so that always makes me happy. The staff knows about the intolerance/allergy issues and they seem to be very careful. Celiac approved! I don't know about any of the other dishes as far as gf safety goes, but the pupusas are a safe bet! 

My friend had the fried plantains and the basil pupusa, and she loved them!

My criticism (and the reason for the lost star) is the cleanliness of the restaurant. The bathroom was quite disgusting when I went in (cool sink though), and not well maintained. Also the restaurant itself was not as clean as it should be. We had a hard time finding a clean table.
author: Isabella I.

description: This place is SF's most famous pupuseria for a reason!  Great food at an affordable price.  If you haven't had pupusas before, fair warning - each individual pupusa may look small, but they are actually quite filling!  I was content after 3.  If you have had them before, then you'll know you're in for a good time!  The combo platters they offer are a great choice, with sides of rice, beans, and slaw.  I was a big fan of the mushroom and chicken.  Overall the restaurant is pretty simplistic, but still a good vibe for a casual dinner.  When we went we also were greeted by the company of a mariachi band!
author: Curren I.

description:
Prices on website ($2/pupusa) do not correspond to menu in restaurant ($4/pc).
Cheese & Spinach are ok, stay clear of beef pupusa.
Won't be back. .
author: Sandra W.

description: A staple whenever I'm in the Mission- amazing, amazing cheap pupusas- it's only 4 stars because of cleanliness and how long your orders can take, and it can be quite the wait. Past that it's a cheap and delicious
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Go here for a late night value on papusas. They are open later than is posted on yelp on Friday and Saturday nights for sure. On 5/13/16 for example the yelp app said they closed midnight but they were going strong till the late night. 

The ambiance of the restaurant itself isn't the attraction... its the value of good late night munchies. If you go after the popular bar hours it will be a cheerful vibe from all your fellow drinkers.

Outside of here tonight there were some musicians and lively people - it is what this area is all about and why people love it.

Go for the food and the people. Take a day off from your diet... prices here are such that you might feel like stuffing yourself silly.
author: Stefan T.

description: I came here for a lite dinner, wanted to try a pupsusa after hearing good reviews about the place. I wasn't that hungry so I only had one the chicken.  It was good, I enjoyed it. I didn't finish it all. What grossed me out was a homeless guy coming in and eating food out of the dirty dish bin.  What surprised me was none of the employees said anything to the guy.  The place is somewhat small and the prices are affordable.
author: Alix J.

description:
Delicious, fresh, piping hot pupusas for super cheap! $3 each.

My boyfriend and I ordered 3 each, but 2 would be enough to feed a normal appetite (we were starving lol). We had pork, beef, chicken, and spinach. I'd recommend spinach for anyone who loves melted cheese because it had the most cheese out of all of the ones we had by far. Chicken seemed to have the most meat out of the meat options I tried. 

But all of the varieties were great! Honestly hard to pick a favorite.

Make sure that you have the plastic containers with red sauce and pickled cabbage on your table. The containers themselves honestly look a bit unsanitary, but...they're amazing on the pupusas. So pile them on your plate. I promise you'll forget about your worries of possible health code violations once you start eating.
author: Sara L.

description: I loved this place until this weekend. I got really sick. I figured when you leave food out, it can get expose to other bacteria and cross contamination. Had the worse stomach pain the whole weekend. I'm disappointed. :(
author: Perry A.

description: Nothing I could say someone else hasn't, but this was one of my favorite Mission late-night snacks. I miss the zucchini and bean pupusas - nothing close in Vancouver!
author: Amanda C.

description: I really liked the chicken and the steak pupusas. It blended in well with the rice and beans.
author: Stephanie B.

description: Holy amaze balls this is so bomb if you don't get over her and try it you will regret this. Always get my order right, big portions, the only thing I don't like is that need to keep there cola champagne stock other than that they are amazing
author: Brandee D.

description:
Delicious hot and cheesy pupusas, a first for me and delicious choice. Asked for their fan favorite and was given the pork one! 

Also got their yuca fries and their tamales, all for around $10 and with a great smile and service.

Got take out and the salsa and relish was wrapped up nicely and packed in. 

McDonalds aint got shit on this "fast food"
author: Jannies L.

description: these are some really great pupusas. a loroco pupusa is my benchmark for salvadorian food and this one was just great. everything on the plate was perfectly prepared, the beans, the slaw, and the plantains. super impressed by this place and the good energy everywhere. looking forward to my next trip to sf.
author: Jerry G.

description: We came for the pupsas, and we left it with bags of pupusas.   This is right down the block from the 16th street Bart station.  They had a lot of different variety for you to chose from, and they will immediately make it fresh for you.   I got one chicken, pork, beef and loroco. It takes a while for them to make it, and when it's ready it's perfect! Nice and hot right off the grill!   My favorite was actually the chicken one. It's actually a nice place, the decor was pretty cool and it's also a pretty clean place.  I love the vibe of this place, you can tell they do a lot of business with the locals, because they always greet everyone by name.   I will def be back!
author: Belinda C.

description: Pupusas are legit! Loroco and Chicken were my favorite! Tamales were as good. Don't forget to order guac and chips! The chips come warm and guacamole is made to perfection! A true hole in the wall but def a must eat!!! Plus, an older man comes around and sings to you. I had to knock off a star because it looked run down.
author: Noor S.

description:
Y'know I'm gonna have to wear my black mantilla and matching shawl as I enter my period of mourning for the impending demise of El Zocalo, home to my favorite pupusas in town. The mamacitas there pounded them to just the right consistency, and the curtido was always freshly made. As you can tell, I'm taking the break-up badly, so of course, Jamie W. and I went to Panchita's for a rebound pupusa. OK, that wasn't really our intention, but Panchita puts herself out there with her sidewalk grill luring young hipsters who have no concept of what a carb is. When the grill isn't out on 16th, there's always the cartoon sign with Panchita holding a tray of her papusas (photo: http://bit.ly/1tqROo4).

Panchita looks like Lucy Ricardo during the pizza-making episode, so the place put us in a good mood right away. All pupusas are $3 each which made ordering easy (photo:  http://bit.ly/Z7e9P3). But first we indulged ourselves with a $4.50 plate of Guacamole with Chips (photo: http://bit.ly/1uP7O8V). Decent though a rather paltry portion with just a handful of chips to keep us occupied until the pupusas arrived. I had one Pork with Cheese and one Mushroom & Garlic with Cheese (photo: http://bit.ly/1oJiC1s). The "with Cheese" is an automatic if you were wondering. They were OK, nothing incredible, and I just wish they were accompanied by a better mix of curtido (photo: http://bit.ly/10DkRha). So it's back to my black mantilla for me and a funereal procession with me carrying a gold-framed photo of an El Zocalo pupusa.

FOOD - 3 stars...passable pupusas and nothing more
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...rather spartan setting but probably handles the shenanigans of drunken youth quite well
SERVICE - 3 stars...nothing I remember with any clarity
TOTAL - 3 stars...the search for the great San Francisco pupusa continues...
author: Ed U.

description: 4 stars. The plate temperature was acceptable. Ended up waiting about 10-15 minutes for the food, otherwise great. Good for when you're drunk.
author: Winston S.

description: DELICIOUS PUPUSAS! I love the pupusas here. They are SO good. The service is okay, a bit slow, but the food is amazing. Definitely love going here whenever I'm in SF.
author: Naomi T.

description: Pork Pupusa's are GREAT! Love how juicy it is. Served nice and warm. Comes with side of pickled vegetables. =)
author: Janan D.

description:
Came here after a nights out in the mission with my brother, bf, and friend. Boy do I love this place! My brother and I grew up eating papusas regularly, and this place is high up on both of our lists. Unlimited amounts of repollo, I THINK YES!

I always opt for the bean and cheese papusa but my friend and bf LOVE the pork one. Reasonably priced, especially for how much repollo/sauce you get.
author: Shela D.

description:
Apparently there is a "safety warning" for this restaurant. You can disregard it. If you walk into a restaurant like this and DON'T know what time it is, lose my number. Try Panera Bread, you bland, miserable lout. 

5 star establishment. It's a pupusa so there's not a ton to elaborate on here. It's cheesy, meaty, and delicious. And at $3 a pupusa, you can get full AF for practically nothing. 

Pro tip: the bar Killowatt is nearby and they let you bring outside food in, soooo...
author: Luke B.

description: $3 pupusas!! And they made one without cheese for me. I also had the chicken dinner entree- I don't recommend that, was just ok. Stick with their delicious pupusas, savory salsa & you'll walk away satisfied.
author: Rob M.

description:
Great little place for a grab and go in the Mission. I mean they give you hot sauce to go in Saran wrap, what's not to love. They also give you a Saran wrap baggie with their cole slaw which, if you stay and eat there, is served in a giant bucket on the table. IT'S ALSO ONLY $3 FOR A PUPUSA

Got a beef pupusa and mushroom pupusa.
They're a bit greasy, but you probably knew that walking in here. loaded their salsa on top and it was amazing!!! the mushroom pupusa especially because you and smell the garlic seeping out with every bite. such cheesy goodness. 

I will be back for more. Definitely back for more, especially if i'm tired of burritos and needed a late night snack in the mission after bars.
author: Tatiana T.

description: We got an order to-go right before they closed. They forgot to include chips and guacamole, and we checked after we left, so we paid for nothing.
author: Tom B.

description: Great if you're ready to wait 30 minutes for your comida. Check in with the waitress after 15 min because they'll likely forget about your order.
author: Sassan M.

description: OoooooMmmmmmGggggg these pupusas will blast you into fucking outer space with out warning!!!! If you want to take a full trip around the sun go ahead and add that red sauce to your bite, you'll be damn near on the floor! Don't trick yourself and get just one, because you'll hate yourself for it. Savor every bite because these pupusas are pure magic!!!
author: Kaylin F.

description: I mean..it was amazing. Fresh, warm pupusas after last call at the bar. They were the best pupusas I have ever had - an L.A. girl from El Salvador.
author: Julissa P.

description: All I can say is AMAZING.  Our first time here   Easy to locate right off the Bart. Easy walk up and order and try to find a place to sit. This place is very popular. Consistent crowd. Food was great. The cabbage at the tables was a perk I love that stuff. Salsa is not spicy at all on the tables.  Great place to go.
author: Jessica M.

description: Came here twice already and I've got to say.. I'm pretty satisfied with the experience. I don't really know what authentic Papusas taste like because the first time I've ever had it in my life is right here at this location but I sure as heck will keep going back! I highly recommend the mushroom and garlic! Mmm soo mouth watering good :)
author: Amy L.

description: Come here eat everything! Don't be shy about trying the fermented cabbage. It's delish with the cheesy papusas
author: Allison J.

description:
What's a papusa you say? Think of a highbred between a tamale and a quesadilla. They create these lovely pillows using masa and just the right amount of cheese and the ingredients of your choice. You have to try them with the cabbage and red sauce that is already sitting on the tables.

How many times have I been here with the gang after a night getting intoxicated on 16th or Valencia streets. Geez... I can't even recall but I can tell you this, I have never left this place disappointed. There are at least 11 options available from mushroom and garlic to pork, chicken, spinach and zucchini. They hand make the papusas outside and heat them up on their propane fueled flattop while you grab a table and prepare yourself for a great meal.

Don't forget to order some plantains as well since they are the perfect accompaniment to your papustastic journey! I will continue to swing by when in the hood, so keep on doing your think crew, we appreciate ya!
author: Josh H.

description: These pupusas are the best you can get, besides my own mother's. The flavor is delightful, and the environment is authentic to street food vendors. The place is very small inside, but small groups could be managed. I wish they had ginger ale beer. My favorites are rebueltas and the jalapeno pupusas.I will literally drive to the bay from Sacramento just for these!!!
author: Amy B.

description: Insanely slow service. I just waited 30 minutes for 2 pupusas and after several half-hearted reassurances that the food was coming, I just left, handing my number to one of the many other people waiting. The food is good but I've never had a good experience here. Not going back and I'd recommend not going here: lots of other choices nearby.
author: Timothy B.

description:
If you like melted cheese, and lots of it, then this is the place for you! I've had pupusas elsewhere that were not nearly as cheesy and had more fillings. Here, the zucchini pupusas have little itty bitty specks of zucchini scattered about within lots of oozy cheese. I like eating my pupusas with the pickled cabbage that is available in plastic jars at many of the tables.

The bathroom leaves much to be desired. But that's not why one comes here. One comes here for the pupusas!
author: I Like T.

description:
Great place after the bars. They have combo plates with beans, platanos,and sour cream to go with your two pupusas. They got the classics like queso and Loroco, but they also have some that you may not normally see like spinach and sausage. 

Also, all the cabbage and sauce you can possibly want!
author: Alicia S.

description: Came here late at about 12 or 1am on a Friday night with some friends.  Have to say this place is a really cool spot for some pupusas.  I ordered 5 pupusas: 3 loroco and 2 revueltas for less than $20 bucks.  Can't beat that price for after-bar-hopping-munchies.  I have to say, this place is definitely quality over quantity-TASTED so GOOD! I would most likely come here again.
author: Roxy P.

description: I've been here in the early evening and late night. The locoro and pork pupusas are great and service is fairly quick.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Thee absolute best Papusas hands down!! Did I mention they're only $3 bucks???  Any and every time I go to SF I have to stop in the mission district to grab the chicken and cheese Papusas... The pickled cabbage is an excellent add on, although I always look at the container with a side eye questioning the cleanliness of the set up. Nonetheless, I always walk right up to the window and holler 

"GET IN MY BELLYYYYYY"

True Story
author: Roxie G.

description:
LOVE this place. The pupusas..... amazing.... say no more!
